intro: Sphyrospermum muscicola, commonly known as the mossy spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by distinctive bracts. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
